intro: Agrimonia hirsuta, commonly known as hairy agrimony, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, serrated, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Agrimonia hirsuta is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils.
